intro: Actinostemon anisandrus, commonly known as the mountain marshmallow, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes plants such as cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its stout, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine white hairs. Its flowers are showy, with five to seven petals and a distinctive central column of stamens. Actinostemon anisandrus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, mountainous climates.
